awd_abstract_narration: Isbell will continue his study of a reinterpretation of                    descriptive set theory, the natural interpretation in metrizable                locales.  This shift has already been shown to produce at least                 one gain in metrizable spaces (the standard setting) although                   there are three or four losses.  The completed work is almost all               in Borel multiplicative class 1.  Most of the main problems now                 visible are in multiplicative class 2 (F-sigma-delta).  Hopeful                 indications that the technical losses by the central                            reinterpretation may be outweighed by conceptual enrichment are                 to be explored.  The goal is to shed light on standard                          descriptive set theory by demonstrating the existence of an                     alternative.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
